newsitem.title: GERMANY: Global linseed supplies seen falling in 1996/97.
newsitem.headline: Global linseed supplies seen falling in 1996/97.

text.p: World linseed production in 1996/97 (Oct/Sept) was forecast at 2.23 million tonnes, down 14 percent from the 95/96 season, the Oil World newsletter said.
The publication cited lower output in Canada, Argentina and Europe and added this would result in stocks reductions of seed and oil in major producing and importing countries.
Linseed crushings in 96/97 would also be lower at 1.95 million tonnes compared with 1.97 million in 95/96.
As a result, lin oil stocks were expected to fall to 87,000 tonnes, or 13.0 percent of annual use, at the end of 96/97 compared with carry-in stocks at 105,000 tonnes (15.8 percent).
Linseed meal stocks were pegged at 16,000 tonnes at the end of 96/97, down from 19,000 tonnes on Oct 1, 1996.
This was assuming a sharp fall in meal exports to 141,000 tonnes (179,000 in 95/96), including a decline in key exporter Argentina's figure to 57,000 tonnes (104,000 in 95/96).
Oil World said European linseed prices, at $323 for Jan/Feb shipment, were 14 percent above levels seen a year ago and linseed expeller pellets, at $267, were up 26 percent.
